questions.clue: In 1876, Alexander Graham Bell was awarded the first patent for this device revolutionizing communication.
This 15th-century invention by Johannes Gutenberg allowed for mass production of books, transforming how information was disseminated.
Henry Ford revolutionized industry in 1913 by using this production method, drastically reducing the time to build a car.
Developed in the late 20th century, this innovation in computing allows multiple devices to connect and communicate over a shared resource.
This powerful language designed by Tim Berners-Lee forms the backbone of the World Wide Web, enabling documents to be linked over networks.
This Baroque composer wrote 'The Four Seasons' concertos.
Known for his ballets, this Russian composer's works include 'The Nutcracker' and 'Swan Lake'.
His 'Messiah' includes the famous 'Hallelujah Chorus'.
She was a virtuoso pianist and composer, known for her piano and chamber music works.
This composer of 'Transcendental Études' was also a virtuosic pianist from Hungary.
This largest animal on Earth feeds primarily on krill and can weigh up to 200 tons.
This slow-moving marine creature has a shell that can regenerate when damaged and is known for cleaning algae off aquariums.
A group of these fish is called a shoal or school; they use this formation for better protection and efficiency in swimming.
This unique marine animal is the only known fish capable of producing its own light through bioluminescence, often found in deep waters.
This type of marine symbiosis involves a sea anemone and a clownfish, where both species benefit from the relationship.
This villainous Moor orchestrates the downfall of Othello with insinuations and deceit.
In 'Macbeth,' this scheming female encourages her husband to commit regicide for power.
This illegitimate son schemes to overthrow his legitimate brother, Edgar, in 'King Lear.'
In 'The Tempest,' this character conspires to usurp his brother Prospero's position as Duke of Milan.
In 'Richard III,' this physically deformed villain manipulates and murders his way to the English throne.

categories.name: Historic Financial Crashes and Their Impact

questions.clue: This 1929 event marked the beginning of the Great Depression, when stock prices on the New York Stock Exchange collapsed.
In 2008, the collapse of this firm is widely cited as a critical moment in the global financial crisis.
Triggered partly by the adverse weather conditions in 1844, this U.S. financial crisis led to widespread bank failures and a deep recession.
This 17th-century Dutch financial bubble burst when the market for a certain type of flower collapsed, creating widespread economic turmoil.
This 1997 crisis started in Thailand when the government decided to float the baht, leading to a rapid devaluation and affecting many Asian economies.

final.clue: First published under a pseudonym in 1719, this novel is considered one of the first English novels, recounting the exploits of a castaway.
